utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi there, I've been having this uhm, cough that's been ongoing for the past two days, and I've started to become short of breath as well. Even with just a little bit of exertion. I've also been feeling feverish and I checked my temperature and it was 38 point, uh, point 5.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, Well that's definitely a fever. Can you tell me a little bit about when the coughing started?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I first noticed it two days ago and it's been kind of just getting a little bit worse over these last two days to the point now where I'm I'm short of breath as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so that's sort of two days ago and then when do the shortness of breath start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, the shortness of breath has been within the last day within the last day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Within the last day, OK. And the coughing is that I dry cough or is it a wet cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm so no sputum or blood.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No sputum or blood in the coughing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. And alright any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had any chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any palpitations of your heart?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no heart palpitations.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And any have you noticed, like a runny nose or a stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't really had a runny nose, no runny nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, no runny nose. That's good, and then any changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No changes to vision or hearing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about changes to your smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No changes to smell or taste. That's been been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Been normal, OK, that's good. And how about of, how about weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had any, uh, any weight loss.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good, any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no rashes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes to your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I I haven't had any. No diarrhea. I have had a little bit of uh like belly pain though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. When did the belly pain start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's just been uh, yeah, within the last day, uh, as well. It just feels a bit uncomfortable kind of all over.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah alright uhm and you don't feel gassy or, or bloated?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and no nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had any. Ah, actually I have been a bit, I've had some nausea as well like that's what I feel like with that with the abdominal pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhmm. OK, And any changes in your smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, so I, actually yeah, with the sense of smell like I haven't been able to smell as well. Now that you ask again, yeah, sorry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, no worries and any appetite changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I haven't. I've had a loss of appetite.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright. Alright, and are you still eating the same or a little bit less?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: A bit less. So I guess I haven't been is hungry. I say similar amount of time just really these last two days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah. Have you had any dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Any memory loss or confusion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Joint aches or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've had like muscle aches. I guess I feel like we've been getting older, but no yeah, I've had muscle aches these last couple of days as well. Kind of generally achy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And are you otherwise healthy or do you have any longstanding medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have diabetes, type 2 diabetes, and I have high blood pressure as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, my weights a bit a bit high.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm and do you take any medications for these things?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I take metformin and I also take an ACE inhibitor, and that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, and are you up to date with your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I believe so yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah. OK. And how about allergies? Do you have any?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think no, no allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of heart or lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, alright, any history of like cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No history of cancer in the family.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not I don't smoke.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You don't smoke, OK. How about recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't use anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK. Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'll have like one beer each day so yeah, about yeah, one beer a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: One beer a day, OK. And where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, so I live in a house with with my wife and ah, and our son.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and anyone at home sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, nobody's been sick at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been in contact with anyone who has been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I don't think so. I mean, I've been going out to do the essentials and uhm, I I do work out at a factory ah and so I mean, there might have been somebody there, but I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no travel, just been going to work and doing the essentials and home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. And any reasons to believe you have old carpet, mold, asbestos, pets, anything at home that could be making your condition worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't believe so. No, we yeah, it's a new a newer home and we've done some renovations.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. Uhm those are all the questions that I had for you today. Did you have any questions of your own for myself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I was just worried that maybe I could have Covid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure, so that's kind of top on my list right now to rule out, so we will do a Covid swab and you should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours with those results. In the meantime, you should isolate for for about 14 days and if your symptoms get worse, go to the ER and if you're experiencing things like weakness, seizures like, and you're not getting any better in a couple of weeks, or you feel dehydrated. Otherwise, supportive care at home, keeping yourself hydrated, eating well, sleeping well, all of those will definitely help as well. Does that sound OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it does. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
